lines.text:
[referring to Carrie's prom gown]
Red. I might have known it would be red.
It's pink, Mama.
[presenting her corsage]
Look what Tommy gave me, Mama. Aren't they beautiful?
I can see your dirty pillows. Everyone will.
Breasts, Mama. They're called breasts, and every woman has them.

[points to a humiliated Carrie after the pig's blood is spilled on her; his voice is blocked out but viewers can clearly read his lips and tell that he is upset and shouting]
WHAT THE HELL?
Tommy?
Yeah?
Why?
Why what?
Why am I here?
Because it's the prom.
Why am I here with you?
Because I asked you.
Why'd you ask me?
Because I wanted to.
Why'd you want to?
Because you liked my poem. Only I didn't write it. Somebody else did.
Oh.
It was bad, Mama. They laughed at me. Hold me, Mama. Please hold me.

I should've killed myself when he put it in me. After the first time, before we were married, Ralph promised never again. He promised, and I believed him. But sin never dies. Sin never dies. At first, it was all right. We lived sinlessly. We slept in the same bed, but we never did it. And then, that night, I saw him looking down at me that way. We got down on our knees to pray for strength. I smelled the whiskey on his breath. Then he took me. He took me, with the stink of filthy roadhouse whiskey on his breath, and I liked it. I liked it! With all that dirty touching of his hands all over me. I should've given you to God when you were born, but I was weak and backsliding, and now the Devil has come home. We'll pray.
Yes.
We'll pray. We'll pray. We'll pray for the last time. We'll pray.
I'm here on the Lord's work, Mrs. Snell; spreadin' the gospel of God's salvation through Christ's blood!
Yes, of course...
These are godless times, Mrs. Snell.
I'll drink to that. Mrs. White, I'd like to contribute five... ten dollars.

[offended]
I see. I pray you find, Jesus.
You too, Chris, and spit out that gum.
Where will I put it, Miss Collins?
You can choke on it for all I care just get it out of your mouth.

[about Tommy's pollution poem]
it's beautiful.
Carrie White! Beautiful, beautiful
[sarcastically joyful]
BEAUTIFUL! Oh beautiful for spacious skies, for amber waves of grain, is that the kind of beautiful you mean, Carrie?
[the whole class laughs]

[reading from a library book]
Telekinesis... thought to be the ability to move... or to cause changes... in objects... by force of the mind...?
We're all sorry about this incident, Cassie.

[voice breaking, shouts]
It's Carrie!
[Morton's ashtray, without reason, flips onto the floor, backwards. Miss Collins jumps back in shock]
She can't get away with this. I'm gonna get her.
Let it go, Chris.
Like Hell, I will!
The period's not up, Hargenson.
It is for me.

[to the other girls]
Keep running!
[to Chris]
Well, there are ten minutes left.
Stick 'em up your...
[Miss Collins slaps her]
You can't hit us! You'll get canned for this, you bitch!
One more word out of you, and I'm gonna knock you down! Do you understand me?
She can't get away with this if we all stick together! Norma? Helen? Sue!
Shut up, Chris. Just shut up.
This isn't over. This isn't over by a long shot!
You're out of the prom, Hargenson.
[she turns to the other girls]
Okay, the show's over. In place! Run! One, two! One, two! One, two!
Witch. Got Satan's Power.
It has nothing to do with Satan, Mama. It's me. Me. If I concentrate hard enough, I can move things.
You must renounce this power. You must give it up. You must never use it.
I'm goin', Mama. You can't stop me. And I don't wanna walk about it anymore.

[to the girls]
Now, my idea for this little trick you pulled was three days' suspension and refusal of your prom tickets.
[the girls gasp]

[in disbelief]
What? God!

That'd get you where you live, wouldn't it? And you deserve it. I don't think any of you have any idea of just how nasty what you did really was. But the office has decided you're to have one week's detention.
[the girls sigh with relief]
Still, there's one little catch. It's to be my detention.
[the girls are once again perturbed]
That's fifty minutes every day starting today in the athletic field. Get the picture?
I'm not coming.
That's up to you, Chris. That's up to all of you. Punishment for skipping detention is three days' suspension and refusal of your prom tickets. Any other thoughts? Good. Now change up.
[the girls proceed begrudgingly]
Where are you going?
Come on.
I'm not coming.
You're really not gonna come? You're gonna miss out on the prom?
I'm not coming.
Well, I'm not gonna miss the prom.
Fuck.
Don't be in such a hurry.
Don't be in such a hurry. I'm hurrying away from you, you know that?
No, you're not.
Pain right in the ass.
I want you to do something.
What?
Something important.
[unzips Billy's pants and performs oral sex on him]
Oh, Billy. Billy. Oh, Billy. Oh, Billy. Billy. Oh, Billy. Oh. Oh, Billy. I hate Carrie White.
Who?
Carrie? Carrie. Carrie, what's the matter? What happened?
Nothing.
Was it one of the girls? Did one of the girls do something to you?
No.
What is it, then? You can trust me, you know that? Would you tell me?
I got invited to the prom.
That's great! That's fantastic! So what are you down here moping around for?
Tommy Ross asked me.
That's even better. He's really cute, huh?
I know who he goes around with. They're just trying to trick me again. I know.
Any criticisms? Anybody?
It's beautiful.

Carrie White! Beautiful. Beautiful. BEAUTIFUL! Oh, beautiful for spacious skies for amber waves of grain. Is that the kind of beautiful you mean? Is it, Carrie? I'm afraid, Carrie, this is hardly a criticism.

[under his breath]
You suck.
Tommy? Did you say something, Tommy?
Who me?
Yes.
I said, "Aw shucks."

[Billy sloshes beer on her clothes as a police cruiser appears]
Watch it, you stupid shit!

[fakes a smile, then turns to her as the cruiser drives off]
Don't call me that!
Well, look what you just did!
[sotto voce]
Dumb shit.

[his back hand slaps her]
I told you not to call me that!

[a car speeds towards them]
Watch out! You wanna get us killed? Dumb shit.
You fuck!
Keep that damned light straight!

[blood drops onto the flashlight]
Watch it, you stupid shit, you're getting blood all over the place!

[starts laughing]
Who are you calling a stupid shit? I mean you can't even keep that fuckin' light straight!
Hurry up! Do you hear me, just hurry up!

[drawls]
Yes, Ma'am! We're doing the BEST we can, we sure are!

[whines]
Just hurry up, I wanna go home!
Just keep your tits on, and I'll let you pull the rope when the time comes.
I intend to.

[winks at her]
I know.
He's not coming.
He is coming, Mama. Now stop it. I'm nervous enough.
No, he's not coming. He's not gonna come.
[scratches her own face]
Go away!
[Margaret slaps herself]
Stop it, Mama!
[Margaret pulls her own hair]
Stop hurting yourself, Mama!
He's gonna laugh at you. They're all gonna laugh at you!
No one's gonna laugh at me, Mama.
Stay here with me.
I don't want to stay here with you, Mama. Now sit down and be quiet.
I'll go downstairs, I'll answer the door. I'll tell him that you're sick. I'll tell him that you changed your mind.

[forces Margaret onto the bed]
SIT DOWN AND BE QUIET!

[gets up from the bed]
Listen, I'll tell him that you changed...

[forces Margaret onto the bed again]
SIT DOWN! Just sit there, Mama, and don't say a word until I'm gone. I'll be home early. I love you, Mama.
[she leaves]
Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.

[preparing to kill a pig]
Here little piggy... I'm gonna bash your little head in, and you don't have to worry about the bomb no more!
That Carrie White, she sure is cute.
Shut up.
I thought you said they were gonna win.
They will. It won't even be close. I called in a few favors.
Carrie, you haven't touched your apple cake.
It gives me pimples, Mama.
Pimples are the Lord's way of chastising you.
What is the big deal?
Because it is a very big deal for Carrie White, and you know it!
Well, she already said no, anyway.
Yeah, well, with a little effort, you can change that.
Don't count your chickens.
Just don't try!
Fine. I won't try.
Hey, wait a second! It's not fine! You can't order someone not to take someone to the prom.
Well, you know, I can make sure that you don't hurt Carrie White anymore.
We're not trying to hurt her, Miss Collins. We're trying to help her!
How? Hey, Tommy. Um, don't you think you're just gonna look a little ridiculous when you walk in the prom with Carrie White?
We don't care how we look. Do we?
Well...
